But, we also believe in  balancing productivity with self-care . That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives. 
 
If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you! 
 
Also, feel free to check out why Business Insider named us an 'enterprise startup to bet your career on"! #WeAreBlushing 
 
All full-time regular employees  will be eligible for the following benefits : 
 
 Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups 
 
 Health benefits: Medical, dental, vision for yourself and covered dependents/domestic partners 
 
 Pre-tax benefits: Medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts, health savings account, 401k, and commuter benefits 
 
 Company-paid life insurance and short/long-term disability insurance 
 
 Paid maternity/parental leave benefits for new parents 
 
 Enhanced employee assistance program for mental wellness 
 
 Position Summary 
 
As a  Web Developer  on the growth team, you will work directly with partners across marketing, product and design teams to ensure the highest level of quality in code, architecture and content production are maintained for Workato's global web properties. 
 
The ideal candidate has been a senior level key developer for large corporate websites, project managed regular code releases, content publishing, maintains a strong working knowledge of content management platforms, and the ability to convert our business objectives into dynamic web experiences that drive the goals of the organization. 
 
Responsibilities 
 
We are looking for a  Web Developer (Full Stack) . In this role, you will be responsible for: 
 
 Hands on full-stack web development for Workato's web properties end-to-end 
 
 Write well-designed, testable code using the best development practices 
 
 Provide code review, quality guidance and design feedback to team members 
 
 Ensure usability and scalability, working with marketing and cross-departmental teams to build new templates/components and publish content 
 
 Support SEO initiatives by identifying and improving site metrics (script loading, page rendering, template architecture, etc.) 
 
 Manage and scale web development processes and regular releases within a disciplined project management schedule and documentation 
 
 Prioritize and triage a high velocity of web requests between bug fixing, new releases, facilitating requests for integrated marketing campaigns, security updates and maintenance 
 
 Requirements 
 Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills 
 
 Proven experience in full stack web development with HTML/CSS, Vue.js, PHP, JavaScript, AWS tooling and GitHub 
 
 Running decoupled enterprise CMS platforms that integrate with a host of marketing technologies (automation, A/B platforms, personalization, ABM scripts, etc.) 
 
 5+ years in a web development role within a marketing organization 
 
 Documented contingency planning for site outages and core web functionality 
 
 Technical knowledge of search engine optimization 
 
 Has established SLAs for various web development and content management requests, with clear communication to colleagues as to the expectations for project delivery 
 
 Experienced in UX testing frameworks and facilitating constructive feedback to web designers for closing the iterative process between design and development 
 
 High benchmark for quality of code and level of user experience 
 
 Ironclad work ethic that thrives on collaboration and is passionate about delivering world class marketing initiatives in a team environment

Title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer - United States - Indeed.com
Description:
COVID-19 Update:  here. 
Our people are our passion at FDM. That’s why we make your training and career growth a priority. Since 2009, we have launched the tech careers of over  3,000  people in the US. FDM is currently seeking numerous ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for tech to work as FDM consultants. We help people like you make their first step into tech every day. Are you ready to make yours?
 About This Role 
As a  Junior Full-Stack JavaScript Developer  with FDM, you will undergo industry specific training and continue your career journey as an FDM consultant by working for one of our globally recognized clients. Some common positions you could be working in include Web Developer, JavaScript Developer, Front-end/Back-end JavaScript Developer.
 JavaScript used to be a language for web front-end development. With front-end frameworks and libraries, JavaScript is also used for mobile applications across a range of operating systems. With the introduction of numerous back-end frameworks it is also possible to use JavaScript for server-side development too, so now web applications can be written entirely in JavaScript. Netflix, Facebook, Uber and LinkedIn are all well known examples of JavaScript based applications
 As a  Junior Full-Stack JavaScript Developer  you will work across multiple projects, primarily in the Digital space, turning concepts into working digital solutions. As part of a cross-functional team you will design, develop and test new features and functionality to deliver a high value customer experience. You will undergo specific training in the core language and all the related frameworks and commonly used libraries. You could be working across any number of industry sectors. 
Minimum Qualifications
 Degree or Diploma
 A natural aptitude for technology and a strong desire to expand your technical skill set. 
Familiarity with any programming language, web or mobile technologies. 
Open to relocate should clients request (limited cities & States) 
Eligible to work in the US. 
Benefits 
 A chance to work for some of the most prestigious companies in the world.
 Opportunity to earn professional certifications related to your career path.
 Continuous career support and upskilling from FDM.
 Comprehensive and competitive benefits package.
 Access to a network of mentors and like-minded individuals. 
Relocation support. 
Industry recognized paid training. 
About the FDM Career Development Program 
FDM’s Career Development Program is a great way for those entering the job market. At FDM, we train the brightest talent to become the innovators of tomorrow. Technology makes the world a better place and we believe passion, drive and curiosity are what you need to have a successful career in tech. This is why we do not require any previous experience to join FDM’s Career Development Program. 
The program begins with training in one of our career streams in business and technology that are in high demand in the job market. We will provide you with the industry-specific technical and professional skills you need in your chosen stream, after which you will start working as an FDM Consultant with our globally recognized clients.
 Upon completion of the program, many see their journey with FDM culminating in an accelerated career progression, better placing them to apply for senior roles within the industry. 
Diversity and Inclusion 
Diversity and inclusion are at the heart of what we value as an organization. FDM is a globally recognized organization with centers across seventeen countries globally. We are proud to celebrate our employee backgrounds consisting over 85 nationalities.
 FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial or local laws.

Title: Full Stack Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
If you’re looking for a best-in-class company where you’ll be encouraged to learn every day, to advance your career, and challenged in new ways—you’ve come to the right job post. 
Our Full Stack Engineers define the technical direction of the client-facing services including data analysis and visualization, APIs, and supporting services. You’ll own both the client-side and mid-tier of our SaaS product. You’ll work closely with other leads responsible for our core data services. 
Most importantly, in your day-to-day you’ll learn, learn some more, and then you’ll keep learning. You’ll also design, deliver, mentor, and review—and repeat. 
Our process 
We run small, agile, cross-functional squads and work in 2-week sprints. At Catchpoint, every individual contributes and makes a lasting impact. We’re on a mission to build a kind, diverse, and open team of world-class engineers. 
Our bi-annual hackathons give Catchpointers the chance to get creative and build out original ideas with a team—many of our hackathon projects become major features and business processes. (And we reward the winners!) 
What you’ll do 
Every day you’ll use Visual Studio, Chrome Dev Tools, and GitHub to expand our React and .NET Core codebase. Along the way, you’ll collaborate with product managers, designers, and your team to build best-of-breed monitoring software. 
What you’ve done 
4+ years of writing great full-stack code 
Know the SDLC inside and out 
Familiar in C#, .NET Core, and other Microsoft server-side technologies 
Just as familiar with React, TypeScript, and JavaScript 
Received a BS or MS in Computer Science or related field. 
Bonus if you have 
Experience with performance monitoring 
Experience developing multi-tenant SaaS products 
Experience with something impressive we haven’t listed? Tell us! 
Overview 
Catchpoint is revolutionizing end-user experience monitoring to help companies deliver amazing digital experiences. Our platform provides complete visibility into your users’ experiences from anywhere – and real-time intelligence into your applications and services to detect and fix issues faster. We are proud to partner with digital innovators like Google, L'Oréal, Verizon, Oracle, LinkedIn, Honeywell, Priceline, and Qualtrics, who trust Catchpoint to improve their brand experience and drive their business success. 
Catchpoint is an equal opportunity employer that strongly prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of any kind. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and engaging environment for all employees. We welcome applications from all candidates and look forward to receiving yours!

Title: Full Stack Engineer - New York State - Indeed.com
Description:
About Medallion: 
 
Medallion's software platform simplifies and automates healthcare administration. In the US, only 40% of the time spent on healthcare is spent with patients; the remaining 60% is purely administrative, spent interacting with a patchwork of state, federal, and insurance bodies to meet the necessary regulatory and compliance requirements. Through an easy-to-use web interface; a complex backend that unifies hundreds of different healthcare entities; and powerful automations, Medallion provides critical administrative infrastructure to make these operations turnkey – enabling a large cross-section of healthcare companies (over 70 and counting!) to spend more time delivering care. 
 
We've raised $50M from some of the best investors like Sequoia Capital, Spark Capital, Optum Ventures, Elad Gil, Peter Reinhardt, and many others. 
 
About the Role: 
 
As a full stack engineer, you will use your ever-growing mastery of web and platform development to lead mission-critical features from end to end. You will be responsible for the technical success of your projects, empowered with all the support, authority, and access you need. Together with a high-functioning team of engineers, PMs, and designers, you will be at the forefront of simplifying healthcare administration in the US, one impactful feature at a time. 
 
You will: 
 
 Lead development of new features from end-to-end 
 Collaborate with PMs and designers to formulate product ideas and project plans 
 Collaborate with other engineers on code, architecture, and internal best practice 
 Make a massive impact on the product :) 
 
 You may be a fit for this role if you: 
 
 Have 2+ years of experience with a modern web stack (Django, Rails, React, etc) 
 Love being a generalist, working with a variety of tools and technologies to build new things 
 Thrive in a collaborative cross-functional environment 
 Care deeply about good code  and  good experiences 
 Are an excellent communicator 
 Get things done 
 
 You might also have an interest in: 
 
 Starting your own company 
 Becoming a tech lead, manager, or PM 
 
 #LI-remote

Title: Full-Stack Engineer, Explorer - California - Indeed.com
Description:
About NEAR And The NEAR Collective 
 
NEAR's mission is to enable community-driven innovation to benefit people around the world. The NEAR platform provides a decentralized application platform that is secure enough to manage high value assets like money or identity and performant enough to make them useful for everyday people, putting the power of Open Finance and the Open Web in their hands. 
 
The NEAR platform, NEAR Protocol and associated tooling are being built by the NEAR Collective, a collection of the best engineers in the world who work across teams, companies and countries similar to other large scale open source projects. Core contributors include a couple of 2-time ICPC world champions, 2 gold medalists, a Latin American champion and multiple other competitive programming finalists. 
 
We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. NEAR is committed to creating an inclusive culture, and we celebrate diversity of all kinds. 
 
About The Role: 
 
NEAR Protocol is a developer-first blockchain that emphasizes convenience and speed of development on the NEAR platform while minimizing the entrance barrier for developers coming from the blockchain ecosystem, as well as regular web and mobile development space. 
 
We are looking for a talented, meticulous, and productive person who loves working in an energetic and free-thinking environment, feels comfortable challenging opinions, and most importantly who shares with us the same desire to make the web free again. 
 
The Explorer team is looking for a person to work on our main dashboard - https://explorer.near.org/. This is a high-stakes project which is central to many users of the NEAR blockchain. 
 
What You'll be Doing: 
 
To be successful in this role, you will need strong experience outputting high precision interfaces and experiences in startup and/or consulting environments. 
 
It requires a deep understanding of modern markup, styling best practices and the implementation of Typescript/JavaScript components in React. In such a dynamic environment, great communication is essential. Your responsibilities will include: 
 
 Designing and building end-to-end full stack product. 
 Collaborating with internal and external engineers and community members. 
 Helping training and mentoring more junior engineers. 
 Participating in the on-call rotation together with other engineers. 
 
 What We're Looking For: 
 
 Ability to design and deliver web applications end to end. 
 The ability to solve all sorts of frontend engineering tasks. 
 Fluency in Typescript/Javascript and web standards. 
 Understanding of React (Next.js) practices (such as state management solutions, server-side rendering). 
 Experience and interest in building and documenting developer-facing tools. 
 Strong communication and remote friendly working skills. 
 
 We'd Love If You Have: 
 
 Open source contributions and previous or continued involvement in open source communities. 
 Familiarity with Ethereum development and related technologies (web3.js, ethers.js, etc) 
 Familiarity with other crypto or blockchain technologies. 
 Experience working at a startup. 
 
 Locations:  Remote (North and South America, Europe) 
 
Working at NEAR:  Roles are posted to this portal on behalf of the companies that make up the NEAR Collective and are typically located anywhere in the world because most of the companies are fully remote. Some hubs are located in Switzerland, Germany, Russia, the US and China. Regardless of where you work, this is a high performance culture that values ownership, execution and professionalism but pairs it with curiosity and experimentation. The vision is big but the right team is behind it.

We’re looking for a Full-Stack Software Developer, with a heavy focus on React, to join our team to help lead the development of features and launch new GasBuddy products on our consumer web properties. You will actively contribute towards the development of web properties and internal tools; integrate against a microservice architecture; and assess, evaluate and rebuild GasBuddy.com. GasBuddy.com receives a tremendous amount of traffic, 1.6 million unique hits per month, and part of your responsibility will be to mirror the mobile experience on the website. What You’ll Do:  Debug, build, and deploy GasBuddy.com and relevant web projects Collaborate and maintain a high standard of communication with team members, designers, product managers to provide end-to-end solutions Develop in a full-stack software system which includes web applications, REST APIs, and microservices Encourage and uphold best practices for web development, including (but not limited to) writing clean and performant code, developing responsive code, and applying accessibility standards Implement practical solutions for large-scale problems as well as everyday quality of life issues Write integration tests for newly implemented code to maintain product integrity Create and review pull requests on a daily basis What You Need:  BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent professional experience 2+ years experience building web applications using React including (but not limited to) personal side projects, school projects, and more Ability to interact with peers, both locally and remote, in a positive, confident, and professional manner Excellent communication skills to deliver verbal and written information for both technical and non-technical users Ability to work effectively both autonomously and while on a team in a fast-paced work environment Strong knowledge of modern frontend JavaScript frameworks, for example: React, Angular, Ember, or Backbone Experience working with Node.js, RESTful services, and building microservices Strong knowledge of Web UI and UX design principles, programming patterns, and best practices Nice To Have:  Understanding of SEO methodologies Experience with agile methodologies Proficiency with accessibility standards About GasBuddy:  For budget-minded drivers, GasBuddy is the travel and navigation app that is used by more North American drivers to save money on gas than any other. Unlike fuel retailer apps, as well as newer apps focused on fuel savings, GasBuddy covers 150,000+ gas stations in North America, giving drivers 27 ways to save on fuel. That’s why GasBuddy has been downloaded nearly 90mm times – more than any other travel and navigation app focused on gas savings. GasBuddy’s publishing and software businesses enable the world’s leading fuel, convenience, QSR and CPG companies to shorten the distance between the North American fueling public and their brands. GasBuddy is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We don’t just accept difference – we celebrate it and thrive on it. We endeavour to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the consumers we serve. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, colour, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, national origin, or any other characteristic protected under federal, provincial, or applicable local law. To all recruitment agencies:   GasBuddy does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, GasBuddy employees, or any other company location. GasBuddy is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered our property and will be processed accordingly. 3FyPld2pdS Job Type: Full-time

Title: Full Stack Developer - ReactJS (Remote) - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
We are interested in every qualified applicant who is eligible to work remotely in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor VISAs. 
 
 Are you a  Full Stack Developer (Remote)  with experience in REACT and NODE?  Would you like to work with the latest technology in AI, machine learning, and chat bots. 
 Are you looking for your next opportunity? If so, consider joining us on our mission of helping our communities achieve better health! 
 
 Get To Know Us! 
 
 GuideWell and its family of forward-thinking companies are focused on helping people and communities achieve better health and are at the forefront in the transformation of health care. 
 Florida Blue, a GuideWell Company, has been providing health insurance to residents of Florida for 75 years. Driven by its mission of helping people and communities achieve better health, the company serves more than five million health care members across the state. We are looking for exceptional people who will bring our mission to life and succeed by putting the member first. 
 
 What We Can Offer YOU! 
 
 We offer competitive salaries and benefits, work-life balance, flexible work arrangements for you, opportunities for growth and development, and a great place to work across our enterprise! 
 Come grow your career with Information Technology (IT)! We build innovative, enterprise-scalable end to end data analytics enabled products and services used by our internal users and external partners including Members, Providers, and Agents, with an emphasis on keeping health information secure and supporting network and data center infrastructure. As we strive to work cross-functionally across the enterprise to build new services, tools, and evaluate new technologies, we welcome self-driven and strongly motivated people who enjoy brainstorming and embrace best practices in secure and scalable design, deployment, and development. 
 
 What Will Be Your Purpose ? 
 
 You will develop, program, and code employee onboarding portals, contact tools, and SmartIVR and Visual IVR systems.
 You will document detailed system specifications, participation in unit testing and maintenance of planned and unplanned internally developed applications, evaluation and performance testing of purchased products.
 You will manage IT Controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity, as well as availability of the application and data processed or output by the application.
 You will work on intermediate level development projects. 
 
 What Will You Be Doing? 
 Develop and update employee onboarding portals our new hires, using ReactJS, NodeJS, MongoDB, and SQL. 
 Build and enhance contact routing tool, a configure call routing for members and provider business 
 Support Smart IVR and Visual IVR tool on the Kore Platform. 
 
 What You Must Have: 
 
 3+ years related work experience in IT development/programming/coding, including work as a full stack developer 
 Experience with ReactJS, NodeJS, and MongoDB 
 High school diploma or GED 
 Experience and understanding with unit testing, release procedures, coding design and documentation protocol as well as change management procedures 
 Proficiency using versioning tools 
 Thorough knowledge of Information Technology fields and computer systems 
 Demonstrated organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills 
 Demonstrated database and SQL skills 
 In-depth understanding of the systems development life cycle 
 Proficiency programming in more than one object-oriented programming language 
Proficiency using standard desktop applications such as MS Suite and flowcharting tools such as Visio 
 Proficiency using debugging tools 
 Strong critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy 
 
 A combination of the following would be helpful, but not required: 
 Agile methodology 
 Bachelor’s degree in a related field IT related field 
 General Physical Demands: 
 
 Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to move objects. Jobs are sedentary if traversing activities are required only occasionally. 
 
 We are an Equal Opportunity/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable culture for our employees and communities. 
 
 Florida Blue is a federal contractor. In accordance with the President’s Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, all Florida Blue employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, unless an employee qualifies for an accommodation for religious or medical reasons. This requirement applies regardless of work location.

Title: Full-Stack Engineer - San Francisco, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
Arc provides SaaS companies with fast non-dilutive growth capital, delivered through a seamless consumerized enterprise technology experience. 
 
Our tech solution and proprietary underwriting model enable us to deliver capital to SaaS founders more quickly and cheaply than legacy offline products, helping founders keep more of the business they built by minimizing dilution. Since launching in September, we have rapidly scaled up customer volume and are looking to expand the team across the board to scale. 
 
Our team of experienced operators comes from Facebook, LinkedIn and Brex and we are backed by awesome seed-stage VCs, including  Y Combinator ,  NFX ,  Bain Capital Ventures  and  Clocktower Technology Ventures . Eric MacFarland, the former Head of Underwriting at Brex, recently joined us as our Chief Credit Officer. 
 
We are seeking a Full-Stack Engineer to join the Arc family. As a member of the product and engineering team, you'll work alongside the CTO to implement both frontend and backend features that are critical to automating our business. 
 
You'll solve hard problems and have a deep impact on the end-product. Expect to work in a fast-paced environment, with amazing engineers who believe in our mission. We're looking for passionate engineers who love building and learning. 
 
Requirements: 
 
 Graduated from a top CS program or 2 years of professional experience 
 Experience implementing product features across both backend and frontend stacks 
 Collaborative and enjoys working in a team 
 
Join us in building out a modern fintech stack to transform financing! 
 
Arc is committed to building an equitable, diverse and inclusive workplace. The Full Stack Web Developer is an expert in interactive front-end experiences and core web technologies such as CSS3, HTML5 and JavaScript ES6. 10% Skill Leadership

7+ years related experience

Title: Full Stack Developer - Austin, TX 78758 - Indeed.com
Description:
At Wondercide, we’re driven by a Fierce Love® for pets and their families. We wake up every day inspired by our mission to protect families of every kind, everywhere from bugs with safe, effective solutions. We work with nature to deliver products that promote well-being. We do this so people can live long, happy, and healthy lives together. We believe in doing whatever it takes to protect those we love…and that when you know better, you do better. 
Our promise to our customers: They’ll never have to go it alone. We’re in this together and we’ll be there to support each step of the way. That’s where you come in! 
We’re looking for a talented Full Stack Developer who will play a pivotal role in managing platforms and processes that support our B2B/B2C presence as well as systems that support our internal teams, including accounting, and operations. 
Role and purpose within the organization: 
This role will report to our Senior Developer and work closely on cross departmental projects. You will support backend functions, help identify and troubleshoot communication inefficiencies with technology solutions, support platform integrations, and provide ongoing technical support for the team. Tasks include: 
 
Work as the first point of contact for cross-departmental issues related to the tech stack, collect requests, and organize for action 
 
Daily administration, issue resolution, and development support across platforms (accounting, ecommerce, fulfillment, etc) 
 
Support on other e-commerce and business systems including Email, SMS, Retention, Subscription, Customer Service, etc. 
 
Support development, testing, deployment, and rollout of updates 
 
Required experience and skill: 
 
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or comparable Work Experience 
 
Integrations applicable to e-commerce, accounting, and inventory management 
 
eCommerce Platforms including Shopify, Shipstation, Yotpo, Recharge, Retention Science, Klaviyo, Swell Rewards, and Zendesk 
 
API integrations 
 
Shipping inventory management 
 
Working knowledge of MySQL databases 
 
Experience using open-source software and organization schema 
 
Google Workspace business landscape 
 
Bonus if you have experience with: 
 
Laravel PHP Framework 
 
Shopify Liquid Templating 
 
Additional knowledge, skills, and abilities we’re looking for: 
 
Desire to learn. Hands-on experience. 
 
Self-motivated and resourceful. You see a problem and find a solution. 
 
Highly-organized and able to prioritize 
 
Detail-oriented 
 
Strong project management skills 
 
Calm under pressure in a high growth, agile environment 
 
Must be ready to multitask, help out across the entire company, and take on new challenges. We all chip in everywhere we are needed, and this position is no different. 
 
What’s in it for you? 
 
We mentioned changing the world, right? Need more? You got it! 
 
Work with a dream team that will support you and help you succeed. 
 
Good pay and benefits including low healthcare premiums, 100% of vision and dental covered, paid volunteer time off, extended maternity and paternity leave. 
 
Performance bonus program. 
 
Company-wide Thankful Thursdays and Fun Fridays. 
 
Fun swag and free Wondercide. 
 
Three weeks of paid time off awarded annually and prorated during your first year of employment. 
 
Paid holidays 
If you’re interested in joining the Wondercide Pack, apply today! 
Wondercide is based in Austin, TX, but this role may be remote. This role is to be filled outside the state of Colorado. 
Wondercide is committed to Diversity and Inclusion. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We encourage all interested and qualified candidates to apply to this position. 
This is a remote position.

Title: Full Stack Java/Angular Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Our deep understanding of regulatory and compliance issues complements the knowledge, technology and solutions we offer to help our clients achieve their business goals. Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle.
 JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION
 Develops core versions of software applications for sale to external clients. Identifies clients' purchasing requirements and technical specifications through Product Management and/or client representatives. Interacts with engineering groups to assist in the design changes to equipment and/or software. Trains and communicates with clients on systems application.
 Note: Incumbents should be assigned to the Programmer Analyst job family if they develop or modify core software applications to meet a client's specific requirements or if they develop or modify internal applications that are not offered for sale commercially. Incumbents assigned to this job family must be reviewed and approved by Compensation.
 GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
 Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs, and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs. Code must be used in the core version of applications available for sale commercially and not that which is customized to meet a specific client's implementation of the application.
 Interacts with product managers and/or users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications.
 Participates in software design meetings and analyzes user needs to determine technical requirements.
 Writes technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements.
 Writes code, completes programming, and performs testing and debugging of applications using current programming languages and technologies.
 Completes documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance.
 May be responsible to develop or execute project plans, budgets, and schedules and for documenting work and results.
 May deliver informational and decision-seeking presentations to technical and business groups to internal and/or external audiences.
 Performs additional related duties as assigned.
 EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES
 A Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or other related discipline; or equivalent combination of education and experience that is required for the specific job level.
 GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
 Experience programming in Java is required.
 Experience with Angular or other web application framework is required.
 Knowledge of end-to-end systems development life cycles (e.g., waterfall, iterative and other modern approaches to software development).
 Experience writing containerized applications using Docker.
 Experience with SQL Server based applications.
 Experience with git version control.
 Experience with Apache Maven
 Experience with package management tools such as npm
 Experience with automation test tools such as Cypress.
 Experience with the Linux command line or Cygwin.
 Must have excellent organizational, follow-up, and note taking skills to ensure meeting and project action items are documented and communicated.
 Must be reachable during business hours regardless of time zone.
 Ability to be available for off-hour technology releases and on-call incident escalations.
 Knowledge of standards relevant to the software industry (e.g., ISO, CMM, Six Sigma).
 Knowledge of banking practices, regulations and operations within assigned line(s) of business.
 In-depth understanding of design patterns and their application.
 Fluency in developing and understanding sequence diagrams, class models, etc.
 Proficiency in solutions design and requirements definition disciplines leveraging model driven design based tools and techniques including conceptual solution component models, business process models, use cases, etc.
 Outstanding verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors).
 Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, team, and time management skills.
 Ability to estimate work effort for project sub-plans or small projects and ensure the project is successfully completed.
 Positive outlook, strong work ethic, and responsive to internal and external clients and contacts.
 May require in-depth knowledge of networking, computing platform, storage, database, security, middleware, network and systems management, and related infrastructure technologies and practices.
 Software Engineer II
 Intermediate professional role. Proficient in at least two higher-level programming languages and knowledge of at least one systems development life cycle model. Understands the products, services, practices, regulations and operations associated with the assigned line of business. Conducts detailed analyses of all defined systems specifications for changes in systems requirements, business requirements or equipment configurations, and develops all levels of logic flow charts. Develops and prepares moderately complex computer programs, prepares program test data, tests and debugs programs. Documents all procedures used throughout the computer program when it is formally established. Receives general supervision and is competent in most phases of programming to work on own, and requires only some general direction for the balance of the activities. May assist and help train Entry-level software engineers. Typically requires five (5) or more years of software engineering work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 Although target pay range may vary by work location, a representative pay range is $70,000 to $90,000. Eligible to participate in medical, dental and vision insurance, life insurance and disability insurance, 401(k) plan and employee stock purchase plan. Eligible to participate in the discretionary annual performance bonus.
 Black Knight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, and protected veteran or military family status. Our employees’ diversity is our strength, and when we embrace our differences, it makes us better and brighter. Black Knight’s commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.
 Location:
 Remote
 Time Type:
 Full time

Title: Full Stack Engineer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Use your knowledge of JavaScript, Python, and SQL to improve the Lex Machina web application as we bring Legal Analytics to all legal practice areas. As a member of our tight-knit remote product and engineering team, you will work with in-house legal experts, customers, and our design team to integrate new legal content and improve our analytics. Our front-end stack includes vanilla JavaScript (ESNext), d3.js, and React, and is built using webpack. We have written our web applications in Python using Pyramid and SQLAlchemy. Offline processing of legal data and other distributed tasks are managed using Python and Celery. This position reports directly to the Director of Engineering. A Typical Week You[1] will write and deploy your own new code creating new interactive visualizations and fixing bugs You will work with our legal experts to integrate new legal subjects and cases You will spend time learning about new technologies to make the product faster and easier to use You will collaborate with Natural Language Processing Engineers to decide how best to incorporate newly extracted information You will debug a distributed task management system and find out just what new things can go wrong with US Government archives Your code will be reviewed by other members of the engineering team, and you’ll review their code too Requirements You have been building web applications professionally for 3+ years You write code in at least one of: Python, Ruby, C#, JavaScript, or Java You think querying complex legal data using SQL databases and counting things could be fun You work well in a team-oriented organization due to your excellent communication skills and empathy You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, code academy, or work experience. Extras Python expertise is preferred; Pyramid expertise is awesome PostgreSQL experience is great; SQLAlchemy understanding is fantastic Reviewable code samples or community participation Compensation, Benefits, and Location Competitive compensation and full benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with matching, short and long term disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, and more This position is available in our Menlo Park, CA office headquarters, or in one of our engineering team clusters in Dallas TX, Denver CO, Sebastopol CA, or Singapore. Fully remote arrangements are possible We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. The Company Lex Machina provides Legal Analytics to companies and law firms, enabling them to craft successful litigation strategies, win cases, and close business. We are the pioneers of Legal Analytics and our award-winning product is used by global corporations such as Google, eBay, Yahoo!, IBM, and Nike, as well as prominent law firms like Wilson Sonsini, Fish & Richardson, Greenberg Traurig, and Fenwick & West. We launched Lex Machina in 2011 for patent litigators and are now expanding Legal Analytics to all areas of the law with the help of LexisNexis, our parent company. In joining us you will help us answer: What really happens when companies and people end up in court? Thinking about how to get more detailed about "what is full stack" at Lex Machina. I think about the flow from sausaging - > search - > front end visualizations as "full stack", at least in my role. Things we could do: - "Use SQLAlchemy and Elasticsearch to search US case law records." - "Build interactive visualizations that analyze/display/organize complex legal data." - "Find and fix bugs ranging from data processing to UI issues." Title: Full Stack Solidity Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Full Stack Solidity Developer:  full-time, part-time, & contract roles all offered Compensation : 40k-120k (depends on experience and time commitment) Start date : flexible (between 10/1 and 12/1) Location:  flexible & could be remote (preferable if near Philadelphia) CommonLands: mission and vision CommonLands is working to turn 1 million families into homeowners in the next five years by creating an accessible and scalable cooperative housing program that provides equitable homeownership for low-income families and the working class. Between homeownership barriers, decades of housing discrimination, and an exorbitant increase in real estate prices, the working class is often trapped in a never-ending renting cycle. It is known that homeownership increases generational wealth; as a result, renting households have drastically less wealth than their home-owning peers. CommonLands is committed to helping close this wealth gap by providing accessible, affordable housing on a national level to support lower-income families and the working class that currently face economic or social barriers to homeownership. We aren’t just developing a program to create accessibility to homeownership, we are also developing a community of support within our homeowners. We will supply the resources, tools, and assets needed to prioritize our community members in becoming self-sufficient, financially stable, and achieving long-term goals. We will take our profits and reinvest them in our communities by focusing on: -Education, Guidance, and Support -Mutual Aid -Community, Real Relationships, and Peer to Peer Transactions -Equity, Trust, and Respect -Empowerment Organization culture:  Our culture is team-oriented, with a collaborative environment, prioritizing trust, communication, and competence. When hiring, we look for strong culture fits, ensuring each team member is passionate about the CommonLands vision, communities in need, an equitable society, and ready to do the work. We care deeply about everyone that works with CommonLands and make certain there is a healthy work-life balance. At its core, we are  for the community, by the community,  and as such will be a community-owned, community-run organization that takes a “needs-based approach” for its decision making. Job brief We are looking for a Full Stack Developer to produce scalable software solutions, through the development of a SaaS-based app and website that will be both on and off-chain. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team and responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment. As a Full Stack Developer, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks, third-party libraries, and programming in solidity. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility. Knowledge and experience with decentralized finance and blockchain are a must. Responsibilities Work with the founding team to ideate software solutions Design client-side and server-side architecture Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications Write effective APIs Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade software Create security and data protection settings Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design Write technical documentation Requirements 3+ years of experience (preferable 5-8) Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role Extensive knowledge and experience programming in Solidity Have completed sites or applications on blockchain Experience developing desktop and mobile applications Ability to program SaaS applications Understanding of decentralized finance Comfortable working with a small team and in a startup environment Knowledge multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery) Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js) Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design Excellent communication and teamwork skills Great attention to detail Organizational skills An analytical mind Ability to work independently and as a team member in a diverse, fast-paced environment. DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:  This can be either an entry-level, mid-level, or senior-level position. Responsibilities will depend on developers’ experience. Extensive solidity development is a huge plus. We are looking for someone with a strong track record of a commitment to social justice; demonstrated commitment to leadership development, community building, and community organizing as strategies for social change; ability to communicate, listen and motivate people to action from diverse backgrounds; strong experience in facilitation, training and leadership development; ability to work nights and weekends as necessary. English/Spanish bilingual skills preferred. Benefits -Being part of the founding team of a soon to be a national organization -Competitive compensation and employee benefits -Collaborative, transparent, and empowering work culture -Flexible work time and work location -Meaningful work on creating better technologies for a fairer future -Playing a key role in solving the US national housing crisis -The potential to become a partner or executive team member Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary Pay: $40,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: We are remote during COVID. Application Question(s): What is your interest surrounding affordable housing in the United States and the housing crisis we are facing? Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Solidity: 4 years (Preferred) SaaS: 5 years (Preferred) Blockchain: 4 years (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote Work Location: Remote

Title: Full Stack Developer, Mid - Washington, DC - Indeed.com
Description:
The Challenge: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to build a powerhouse system that will modernize IT systems across the Federal Government? You know a good application is more than just a nice-looking interface + data and you need the right combination of clean code, APIs, analytics, and infrastructure to help your team build a user focused solution. As a software engineer, you’ll have the chance to build your skills and solve a problem with a complete end-to-end solution in a fast-paced, agile environment. We’re looking for someone like you with the skills and experience to build solutions that assist the government in providing services to citizens. 
As a software engineer on our team, you’ll work directly with your customer to overcome their most difficult challenges using the latest architectural approaches like microservice APIs in a containerized environment, alongside open source frameworks and tools like GitHub, mongoDB, and swagger. You’ll use your passion to learn new tools and techniques, identify and implement system improvements, and mentor teammates. Using an agile software development process, you’ll build applications using Java, C#, or other coding languages to build applications with a variety of front end technologies and databases. You’ll analyze the needs and the environment to make sure the solution you’re developing considers the current architecture and operating environment, as well as future functionality and enhancements. 
Work with us as we build systems to change government IT solutions for the better. 
Join us. The world can’t wait. 
You Have: 
Experience with back-end coding languages including java, C#, or PHP 
Experience with modern system architecture principles including microservices or APIs 
Experience in designing and building frontend applications using React, Redux, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript 
Ability to obtain a security clearance 
Bachelor’s degree 
Clearance: 
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. 
Build Your Career: 
A challenging and dynamic work environment isn’t all we have to offer. When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have access to: 
experts in virtually every field 
a culture that focuses on supporting our employees 
opportunities that provide stability while offering variety 
You’ll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources through our Digital University, an online learning portal featuring more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success. 
We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

Title: Full Stack Engineer - United States - Indeed.com
Description:
About Bill.com 
Bill.com, together with its wholly owned subsidiaries Divvy and Invoice2go, is focused on being the one stop shop that simplifies, digitizes, and automates complex financial operations for small and midsize businesses. Customers use the platform to manage end-to-end financial workflows and to process payments. The AI-enabled, financial software platform creates connections between businesses and their suppliers and clients. It helps manage cash inflows and outflow. The company partners with several of the largest U.S. financial institutions, the majority of the top 100 U.S. accounting firms, and popular accounting software providers. Bill.com has its headquarters in San Jose, California with offices in Houston, Texas, Draper, Utah, and Sydney, Australia. 
Mission:
 Invoice2go, a subsidiary of Bill.com, is a technology company that helps small business owners run and grow their business their way. Simple from start to finish, Invoice2go gives users an all-in-one platform to manage customer relationships, send invoices, accept payments, improve cash flow, create an online presence, and much more. These features help users stay organized, look and feel professional, win more jobs, and ensure that tax season is a breeze. 
We’re looking for a strong Software Engineer to join our Growth Team. As a key contributor, you’ll be responsible for owning full stack projects to create and evolve our Growth platform. Your day to day will involve working across various components of our server platform, developing and maintaining capabilities ranging from purchasing, pricing, subscription management, experimentation and delivery of in-app banners. The Growth team is broadly responsible for multiple screens and capabilities within our product on all platforms - web, iOS and Android - as well as the marketing site and most of this is powered by our server stack. 
This role is cross functional and focused on delight; you’ll be working with the broader marketing team and the front end development team to create magical moments for our users. You’ll be a critical contributor to the team's growth and have the opportunity to influence the roadmap for the Growth team. 
 Professional Experience/Background to be successful in this role: 
Strong fundamentals of HTML, Javascript, and CSS. 
Willingness to learn new technology as needed. 
Fluent in at least one modern web development framework (e.g. React, Vue, Angular). 
Strong fundamentals of HTML, Javascript, and CSS. 
Willingness to learn new technology as needed. 
 Competencies (Attributes needed to be successful in this role): 
3+ years of development experience 
Ability to own the entire client side feature development with some ability on the backend. 
Be an advocate of good software design and quality best practices. 
Plan, create and deliver high quality software solutions, working as part of a cross functional team. 
Find better ways to solve existing problems, and work sustainably to minimize long term tech debt. 
Owning delivery of web projects end to end for the team 
Working closely with web engineers from across the company to define the technical direction for the web platform at Invoice2go 
Participating in team quality processes and owning the quality of our features in production 
 Expected Outcomes in 3, 6, or 12 months: 
Create new platform capabilities that the Growth team can use to drive registrations and subscriptions, e.g. a new referral engine and new product packaging models.

Title: Full Stack Developer (Stealth Startup) - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Atomic is a venture fund that founds companies. Founded in 2012, we believe that disruptive innovation is most successfully achieved by pairing innovative ideas with business discipline, and that building those ideas into businesses is not something that can be outsourced. We are engineers and entrepreneurs who build and operate the next generation of great companies. 
We are seeking a Full Stack Developer for one of our pre-launch Startups in the education space. 
About the Role 
We are looking for hungry and talented full stack engineers to design and build features that power a great educational product for families with school aged children. You will be a founding member of the team shipping the first version of our product and will create microservices, integrate web services, and build the web-front-end of our product. Are you passionate about making significant contributions to a product and growing your skills as an engineer in multiple areas? If so, you’ll love our team! 
 You're a good fit if you are: 
Looking for the opportunity to have a big impact at an early company 
Eager to learn new technologies 
Passionate about web development 
Love to build things 
 What You'll Do: 
Get to help define the foundational stack of our product 
Grow your skills and build features end-to-end, getting exposure to all layers of stack 
Contribute to many areas including design and product 
Collaborate with top-notch people passionate about building great products 
Ship a meaningful product that delights parents and their school aged children, solving an emotional and rewarding problem for our customers 
 What You'll Bring: 
1-3 years of consumer facing application development experience 
Strong in JavaScript fundamentals and libraries, HTML/CSS 
Experience with creating backend services with Python, Go or Javascript and tying to user-interface features 
Experience with frontend frameworks like React and Vue 
Experience with RESTful APIs and how to integrate server data into a web application 
Understanding of use cases for relational and non-relational data, and experience with database platforms (RDBMS, NoSQL, shared storage, ETLs, queuing systems, Pub/Sub, Message Buses) 
Experience with HTML optimizations including CDN usage, caching strategies and efficient media handling 
Experience with cloud providers like AWS, GCP, or Azure 
 Bonus: 
BS or MS Computer Science/related fields or relevant bootcamp 
Passionate about creating products for children and families 
Experience working in CI/CD workflows 
Test-driven development 
 We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Title: Full Stack Engineer - New York State - Indeed.com
Description:
About Medallion: 
 
Medallion's software platform simplifies and automates healthcare administration. In the US, only 40% of the time spent on healthcare is spent with patients; the remaining 60% is purely administrative, spent interacting with a patchwork of state, federal, and insurance bodies to meet the necessary regulatory and compliance requirements. Through an easy-to-use web interface; a complex backend that unifies hundreds of different healthcare entities; and powerful automations, Medallion provides critical administrative infrastructure to make these operations turnkey – enabling a large cross-section of healthcare companies (over 70 and counting!) to spend more time delivering care. 
 
We've raised $50M from some of the best investors like Sequoia Capital, Spark Capital, Optum Ventures, Elad Gil, Peter Reinhardt, and many others. 
 
About the Role: 
 
As a full stack engineer, you will use your ever-growing mastery of web and platform development to lead mission-critical features from end to end. You will be responsible for the technical success of your projects, empowered with all the support, authority, and access you need. Together with a high-functioning team of engineers, PMs, and designers, you will be at the forefront of simplifying healthcare administration in the US, one impactful feature at a time. 
 
You will: 
 
 Lead development of new features from end-to-end 
 Collaborate with PMs and designers to formulate product ideas and project plans 
 Collaborate with other engineers on code, architecture, and internal best practice 
 Make a massive impact on the product :) 
 
 You may be a fit for this role if you: 
 
 Have 2+ years of experience with a modern web stack (Django, Rails, React, etc) 
 Love being a generalist, working with a variety of tools and technologies to build new things 
 Thrive in a collaborative cross-functional environment 
 Care deeply about good code  and  good experiences 
 Are an excellent communicator 
 Get things done 
 
 You might also have an interest in: 
 
 Starting your own company 
 Becoming a tech lead, manager, or PM

ABOUT RELATUS 
Founded in 2020, Relatus is a new platform for networking, relationship building & social knowledge collaboration and engagement for achieving goals and developing purposeful relationships powered entirely by shared relevance. 
Utilizing targeted social and knowledge graphing methods, Relatus develops, enriches, and enhances your professional, personal and social relationships to help you achieve, generating trusted relationships based on shared criteria and relevance between those you know, and those you need to know. 
Leveraging machine learning, data science, algorithmic social engineering methods and proprietary relationship data, our service integrates with your existing networks and contacts to connect you to a deeper knowledge base that identifies and develops new introductions, connections and relationships of context, relevance and integrity with those who can best enable you to reach your goals and achieve your mission. 
To learn more about Relatus, please visit us at http://relatus.com 
ABOUT THE TEAM 
Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with remote offices and operations in Seattle, WA, Relatus was founded by a team of seasoned industry professionals with decades of combined experience in professional networking and relationship management, people search and social engineering, lead generation and outbound marketing, and algorithmic social and knowledge graphing technologies and machine-learning platforms. 
With teams and operations geographically dispersed across the globe, we’re perfectly adapted to communicating, collaborating, and achieving results with our team members, clients, and users via remote work practices. 
We are a talented, resourceful group of 15+ employees working together remotely across the globe and throughout the US, Europe, South America, and India. At Relatus, you’ll find a unique culture, an amazing community of intelligent, hard-working, and thoughtful people building great things for people with a mission. 
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR 
Relatus is looking for a  Full-Stack PHP Front End Engineer  to join our Product Development organization to support and extend a Laravel/Vue.js web application and additional microservices based on the core application. Successful candidates will have a minimum of five years of professional application development experience and possess all of the skills and attributes listed below. 
Your primary responsibilities will be to develop the framework application logic and implement the front-end user interface. This role will work with the development lead to design, implement and code the database and application architecture, and a UI/UX designer to define and design the application user flows and logic. 
WHAT YOU’LL DO 
Build the customer-facing UI and necessary back-end services for data management, administration and reporting 
Code, test and manage Vue.js based applications 
Work closely with a data model built on a PostgreSQL database 
Write reusable, testable, clean and well-documented code 
Create and manage database schemas that represent and support business processes 
Write robust unit tests and validating code with available tools 
Work with 3rd party services like Zapier to integrate external and back office application data into the web application 
Work as part of a team developing applications and services using Agile development methods 
Participate in the team's processes and collaboration platforms 
Contribute proactively to process and solution improvements 
DESIRED INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE 
Commercial Software or Services 
Venture Capital, Banking or Financial Services 
Travel or Hospitality Services 
Marketing or Advertising 
Social Networking 
QUALIFICATIONS 
Strong proficiency with JavaScript or CoffeeScript 
Strong knowledge of Vue.js and Laravel frameworks preferred 
Strong knowledge of Google Cloud Platform services preferred 
Strong knowledge of SQL and database synchronization and optimization techniques 
Strong understanding of application concepts and third-party API service integration 
Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML5, Bootstrap/Tailwind and CSS3 
Good understanding of user accessibility principles and data privacy compliance 
Good understanding of UX optimization for delivery platforms, such as mobile versus desktop, and optimizing output for the user platform 
Strong attention to detail 
Take pride in producing error-free code 
Strong knowledge in Object Oriented Programming 
Good experience with Linux is a plus 
YOU ARE 
Obsessed with user experience and creating beautiful, frictionless applications 
A self-starter who can manage multiple priorities and deadlines 
Capable of turning general requirements into specific estimates and deliverables 
Able to see the “big picture” and can find ways to enrich and enhance products through better feature and functional usability 
Comfortable working with a remote global team, and willing to make adjustments to work hours as needed 
ROLE REQUIREMENTS 
Proficiency in cloud services such as Google Cloud Platform or AWS 
Expert experience in one or more coding languages, PHP preferred 
Expert experience with commercial frameworks, Laravel preferred 
Expert experience with ORMs and API development 
Strong time management and organizational skills 
Collaboration style to work with a small and agile engineering team 
Excellent documentation habits 
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE 
At least three years of experience with: 
Writing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript based on current UI standards and best practices (HTML5, CSS3 and ES6) 
PHP >=7.x with Laravel framework experience preferred 
Sound understanding of database design and change management 
Vue.js front-end framework and addons 
Integrating 3rd party services and APIs 
Familiar with CSS preprocessor tools and associated languages, syntaxes and libraries 
Experienced with the Google Cloud Platform services 
Experience implementing testing platforms and writing comprehensive unit tests 
Proficiency with Github 
Experience with production code branching and release management 
A four-year degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Web Development, or User Experience Design 
BONUS EXPERIENCE 
Python 
Alembic 
FastAPI 
SQLAlchemy 
Flutter 
COOL STUFF YOU’LL RECEIVE IN RETURN 
Access to and opportunity to collaborate with new startups, exciting entrepreneurs, leadership teams, industry-leading fund, and venture capital companies and socially-relevant and impactful creative enterprises and cause-based organizations 
Ability to help bring new products, services, and socially-relevant organizations to market, working with emerging companies to help build the next, and create a window into new markets, audiences and trends of the future with a variety of different clients, working to contribute/enable good in the world 
Opportunity to work with an innovative company and fun, talented team on a powerful mission to help professionals, small and large businesses and socially impactful organizations connect and grow together 
Lots of autonomy and work independence, ability to contribute to product vision 
Substantial opportunity for role growth potential and position advancement 
A collaborative, diverse workforce and inclusive, listening work environment 
Role autonomy, ownership, empowerment, and decision authority 
Early equity participation 
Medical, Dental, Vision benefits 
INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EEOC 
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Relatus company culture. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to understand the needs and interests of our diverse workforce. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives from all walks of life.

Title: Full Stack Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
We are looking for a Full Stack developer to take our integrations to the next level as we rapidly expand our Data Analytics team. You’ll be getting stuck into loads of web and web3 integrations, working with cutting edge crypto data and owning your data pipelines from extraction through to analytics output. 
 
 Every day you’ll be presented with a new challenge, whether optimising your own ETL processing, modularising your code or producing insightful analytics, what you do will be at the forefront of the crypto industry. We want you to grow and learn so you’ll be getting stuck into projects from across the business, delivering products and applications that run efficiently and scale effortlessly. To excel here at Chainlink Labs you’ll need to have a broad range of technical experience and enjoy working independently in a vibrant and creative environment. 
 
 
Your Impact
 Building out the logic and UI for automated data flows, utilising python and sql procedures to transform data for analytics use 
Designing and deploying custom API’s so our front end apps can seamlessly transfer data, helping our teams rapidly scale their processes 
Becoming the subject matter expert on new softwares we look to bolt onto our stack, including a tonne of crypto and web3 applications 
Diving head first into bleeding edge crypto projects, utilising our Big Data solution in GCP 
On the fly fixes and patches to meet launch targets and create a great user experience for everyone 
Automated maintenance and monitoring of your own data pipelines, we want you to spend time growing and developing 
 What you’ll be great at
 Building integrations for software/app that you’ve never seen before 
Creating slick and intuitive UI’s with cutting-edge UX to empower users to own their data 
Designing and interacting with REST API’s, RPC, GraphQL, XMLA/DAX and relational databases 
Designing workflows that can be easily upgraded with rich new features 
Implementing best in class database design principles 
Providing analytics the business can use to inform key decisions using Power BI and Google Data Studio 
Breaking down complex business requirements into simple modular operations 
Our Principles 
At Chainlink Labs, we’re committed to the key operating principles of ownership, focus, and open dialogue. We practice complete ownership, where everyone goes the extra mile to own outcomes into success. We understand that unflinching focus is a superpower and is how we channel our activity into technological achievements for the benefit of our entire ecosystem. We embrace open dialogue and critical feedback to arrive at an accurate and truthful picture of reality that promotes both personal and organizational growth. 
About Chainlink Labs 
Chainlink is the industry standard oracle network for connecting smart contracts to the real world. With Chainlink, developers can build hybrid smart contracts that combine on-chain code with an extensive collection of secure off-chain services powered by Decentralized Oracle Networks. Managed by a global, decentralized community of hundreds of thousands of people, Chainlink is introducing a fairer model for contracts. Its network currently secures billions of dollars in value for smart contracts across the decentralized finance (DeFi), insurance, and gaming ecosystems, among others. The full vision of the Chainlink Network can be found in the Chainlink 2.0 whitepaper. Chainlink is trusted by hundreds of organizations—from global enterprises to projects at the forefront of the blockchain economy—to deliver definitive truth via secure, reliable data. 
This role is location agnostic anywhere in the world, but we ask that you overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST). 
We are a fully distributed team and have the tools and benefits to support you in your remote work environment. 
Chainlink Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 
#LI-Remote

Title: Software Dev Engineer II, AWS EBS Performance Tools - Boston, MA - Indeed.com
Description:
2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience 
 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design 
 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems. 
 Excellent communication skills and team player 
 Experience designing excellent services 
 
Job summary
 The AWS Elastic Block Store (EBS) service delivers high performance virtualized storage "in the cloud" for EC2 and we are still in the early stages of realizing its full potential. Are you a full stack developer with a passion for improving the performance and scalability of one of the largest distributed systems in the world? If so, the EBS Performance Tools Team is looking for you. From the operating system requesting data, to the storage processing the request, to the network connecting the components together, the Performance Tool Team builds tools to monitor and measure the customer’s end-to-end performance experience and to automate root-causing and mitigation of performance issues. The ideal candidate would possess analytical, design, problem solving skills and experience in building & operating full stack applications. You will work closely with a tight, agile team that ships often, iterates quickly, and takes pride in the product they deliver.
 
Inclusive Team Culture
 Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
 
Work/Life Balance
 Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
 
Mentorship & Career Growth
 Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
 
To learn more about EBS, see https://aws.amazon.com/ebs/.
 
What is EBS and what do we do?
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wsMWANWNoqQ
 
 Learn about the latest EBS offerings from re: Invent 2020: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RxOPNU3Wm18
 
 Learn about upcoming EBS features in Andy Jassy’s 2020 re:  Invent Keynote:
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xZ3k7Fd6_eU
 
Key job responsibilities
 
 Design, implement, deploy, and maintain innovative and high quality full stack applications to monitor and measure EBS server performance and to automate root-causing and mitigation of performance issues before our customers get impacted 
 Collaborate with customers and AWS leaders and data scientists to convert your observations and your software, hardware, and performance engineering expertise into impactful product enhancements 
 Use C, C++, Java and software engineering best practices to deliver high quality software on time 
 Work in an agile development environment, where you are always working on the most important stuff 
 Mentor junior software development engineers 
 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience 
 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design 
 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems. 
 
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
